reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back having stayed 4 nights at the hotel. We booked it last minute and I must admit I hadn't had much time to research the hotel but it was a cheap deal and decided just take it as we found it. We got a room on the fourth floor with a balcony and with a view of the side of the hill which was great as the sun shone there in the afternoon. The room was spotless and I mean spotless the bathroom was large and the corridor had the smell of fresh carpet so I don't know whether all the rooms had been recently refurbished. The breakfast was also very good with a hot and cold buffet selection. I managed to lock myself out of our digital room safe and went to reception to request assistance. Reception advised me to return the room and I no sooner had gone through the door when a member of staff arrived and sorted it out. The staff we came across during our stay were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.text: We paid 22 euros from the airport and 16 on the return. The hotel is at the foot of the Santa Barbara Castle with great walks and views from the top. We could find no complaints with the hotel and it was great value for money.
reviews.title: The view only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The excellent view is what this hotel has going for itself. The location is excellent, right next to the beach, overlooking the sea and next to the Al Campo shopping centre. Otherwise, the furnishings are ver old, the beds uncomfortable, the bathroom really dingy. The cleanliness of the room and areas was good, but the dishes at breakfast were dirty and it happend over and over again. The breakfast was ok, it was a lot of variety, but difficult to eat on dirty dishes.
reviews.title: Central, good service and good value for money

reviews.text: The staff spoke very good English, but was extremely dry and unfriendly.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Very good service, the receptionists spoke english, the rooms were big, and welcomingly looking. The bathrooms were big and with a tub. The bed was like sleeping on a rock, but otherwise no complains. It i central, and stil close to the beach and the old city. there is a busstop with a direct rute to the airport and at tramstop right next to the hotel. We booked our hotel through trivago, end the prices changed alot, so if you want to stay at Maya keep and eye on the prices, if we had made a reservation 2 days before we did, we could have saved ca. 40 euro on our 7-day stay
reviews.title: Still the perfect hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here to be near the city and while it seemed to be in an awkward spot in reality it was very convenient and within walking distance to transportation and the Castillo de Santa Barbara. The continental breakfast was great and the pool areas bar service was exceptional as the staff was very friendly. The room was clean and offered us a view of the sea. I would recommend this hotel as a good value.
reviews.title: Centrally located excellent service and friendly staff.

reviews.text: Stayed in Hotel Maya for 4 nights. Nice 3 star hotel, clean. Had triple room sharing with 2 girls. Breakfast every morning was great - good variety. WiFi brilliant across hotel & free. Room cleaned daily with fresh towels. Massive shopping centre across the road which was brilliant - open till 10pm! Pool clean but a little deep. Baby pool also. Reception staff very helpful. 5-10 min walk to beach. A/C great.
reviews.title: Good stay, clean, nice pool

reviews.text: Ate in the pool bar - didn't like it, food wasn't the best there. Hotel located on the outskirts of the City. We ended up getting a taxi in & out every evening(€5) as it was a little dangerous walking ourselves, the area is a little run down. Day time walking is perfect. Walk is a good 10-15 mins to centre.
reviews.title: Should be a four star hotel, not three!

reviews.text: I have just come back from staying here for 4 nights with a friend. It was excellent! The staff at reception were extremely helpful and friendly. We arrived early and check-in was at 3pm however they ensured they were quick to get our room ready by 1.30pm while we waited at the pool and had a drink (they put our bags behind the reception desk) The room was bright and airy and fairly big. Very well cleaned and it was cleaned every single day we were there. Beds were made and the bathroom cleaned and towels were changed. The pool area was clean although there were often not enough sunbeds. We did not eat in the hotel apart from toasties and room service on our first night. It wasn't 5 star dining but the food was nice.
reviews.title: A nice hotel for a quiet break
Good location
reviews.text: The location is also great, a 10 minute walk to the beach and 15 minute walk into town. Along the front there are loads of bars and restaurants and a night market. The beach is lovely to walk along although quite busy so would be advisable to get there early! From our balcony we had a view of the pool and the castle. The castle was beautiful when lit up at night and you can walk up to it or walk ten minutes into town to get a lift to the top. Definitely worth it for the views of Alicante.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a week here, staff on reception very helpful and friendlyalways aknowledge in passing good choice food at breakfast, rooms are a good size television and drinks bar if required,a good sized swimming pool &sunbathing area. Tram service in easy access if you want travel along the coast line to benidorm saint vincent and would recomend you spend the day at EL COMPELLO for its scenic sea front and fish chips and mushy peas at Bernies will defintly come again.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.text: We spent four nights here and found the location great the train station is two minutes way so you can be in benidorm in a hour the centre of alicante is ten minute walk but there is a bus stop out side the hotel if you don't fancy the walk its five euros for a taxi back late at night the hotel is spotless and maid service every day hair dryer and English tv good breakfast and excellent service what more can you ask for great stay
reviews.title: Top hotel great location

reviews.text: My husband had stayed here before when it was under a different management so expected good things. We had however a lovely room, bathroom and sea view. There was wheelchair access to the rooms. The beach was only five mins away and if you could not get round the pool you had an amazing beach and sea to enjoy.
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.text: Th food was good and was buffet style for both breakfast and dinner. There were however many local restaurants close by if you wished to dine out. We had unfortunately a couple of issues with housekeeping but the hotel did act accordingly when notified.
reviews.title: Business trip
Brilliant Hotel
reviews.text: The Maya is an average hotel and value for money. There are more expensive hotels on the sea front but the Maya was sufficient for what we wanted. Would we stay there again, yes we would.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just got back from 7 nights at Hotel Maya. The hotel itself is really clean, good sized rooms. We found the location really good, with a 5 minute walk to the beach and the centre of Alicante. We got the C6 bus to and from the airport which is perfect, only 2.75 euros each so really cheap! and the bus stop is a minute from the hotel
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We do have to agree with others, with regards to the "thin" hotel walls, thankfully for us it was only our last few nights were we had children next door, that were a little loud but nothing too bad.
reviews.title: Happy Guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had views of the Santa Barbara Castle, which were gorgeous, and the castle and its grounds are stunning - we visited it twice we loved it so much.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this hotel. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Very comfortable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned today from spending a lovely week in The Hotel Maya. Room was clean and spacious. We requested a sea view which was on the 6th floor and was stunning. 5 min walk to the beach and tram stop. Only ate in hotel once (buffet breakfast-fantastic selection) but that isnt a reflection on the hotel as we booked room only as we wanted to eat somewhere different every night. Staff very friendly and helpful. Our only negative feedback is that the walls are so thin between rooms that you can hear everything-conversations,doors closing,toilets flushing-we got our early morning wake up call from the germans next door who were early risers. Would recommend this hotel to family and friends.
reviews.title: really worthy for three star
